qahramon

Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Character
      • qahramon.Hero

  • public class Hero
extends Character
    A class of heroes as special kinds of characters involving strength.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariant:
    Each hero must have a valid strength.
        isValidStrength(getStrength())

    • Constructor Summary

      Hero(java.lang.String name, int hitpoints, float strength, java.util.HashMap<AnchorType,Item> items)
      Create a hero with a given name, amount of hitpoints, strength and gear.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        public Hero(java.lang.String name,
            int hitpoints,
            float strength,
            java.util.HashMap<AnchorType,Item> items)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a hero with a given name, amount of hitpoints, strength and gear.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this hero
        hitpoints - the amount of hitpoints of this hero
        strength - the strength of this hero
        items - the initial gear of this hero
        Postconditions:
      • When the given strength is higher than the default strength, the hero's strength is set to the given strength, otherwise the default strength is set.
            new.getStrength() == strength
      • Equip the given items on the given slots of this hero. Only what this hero can wear is equipped, all other items are dropped.
            for each (Entry entry : items.entrySet()) {
             this.equip(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
            }
        • Effect:
        The new hero is set as a character with a given name, amount of hitpoints and a default number of anchors.
            super(name, hitpoints, AnchorTypes.values().length)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception when the given name is not valid. | !isValidName(name)

      • Hero

        public Hero(java.lang.String name,
            int hitpoints,
            float strength)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a hero with a given name, amount of hitpoints and strength.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this hero
        hitpoints - the amount of hitpoints of this hero
        strength - the strength of this hero
        Effect:
        The new hero is set as a character with a given name, amount of hitpoints, a default number of anchors and starter gear.
            this(name, hitpoints, strength, getStarterGear())
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • canHaveAsName

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsName(java.lang.String name)
        Check if a hero can have the given name as name.
        Overrides:
        canHaveAsName in class Character
        Returns:
        Return true when the given name starts with a capital letter, only contains letters, maximum two apostrophes, spaces and colons followed by spaces. Otherwise return false.
            result == (name != null
             && name.matches("(?![^:]*:([^ ]|$))(?![^']*'[^']*'[^']*')[A-Z][A-Za-z' :]*"))
        Note:
        Match the given characters starting with a capital letter and returns false when it contains a : without a space or 3 apostrophes.

      • isValidStrength

        public static boolean isValidStrength(float strength)
        Return true when a hero can have the given strength.
        Parameters:
        strength - The strength to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given strength is positive.
            strength >= getDefaultStrength()

      • multiplyStrength

        public void multiplyStrength(int factor)
        Increase the hero's strength, by multiplying with the given factor.
        Parameters:
        factor - factor to multiply the strength with
        Postconditions:
      • If the given factor is positive and the new strength is valid, the strength of the hero is multiplied by the given factor.
            new.getStrength() == this.getStrength()*factor
      • If the given factor is negative or the new strength is invalid, the strength remains the same value.
            new.getStrength() == this.getStrength()

      • divideStrength

        public void divideStrength(int divisor)
        Decrease the hero's strength, by dividing by the given divisor.
        Parameters:
        divisor - the divisor to divide the strength by
        Postconditions:
      • If the given divisor is positive and the new strength is valid, the strength of the hero is multiplied by the given divisor.
            new.getStrength() == this.getStrength()/divisor
      • If the given divisor is negative or the new strength is invalid, the strength remains the same value.
            new.getStrength() == this.getStrength()

      • getProtection

        public int getProtection()
        Return the protection of the hero.
        Specified by:
        getProtection in class Character
        Returns:
        Return the protection of the hero based on default protection value and armor, when no armor is equipped the result will be set the default protection of this hero.
            result == getDefaultProtection() + ((Armor)(this.getItemAt(AnchorType.BODY.getAnchorId()))).getProtection()

      • wantsToTake

        public boolean wantsToTake(Item item)
        Check whether or not the hero wants to take an item.
        Specified by:
        wantsToTake in class Character
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be considered to take
        Returns:
        Return true when the item is an armor that has higher fullProtection than the fullProtection of the best armor this hero is currently holding. Return true when the item is a weapon that has higher damage than the damage of the best weapon this hero is currently holding. Return true when the item is a backpack that has higher capacity than the capacity of the best backpack this hero is currently holding. Return true when the item is a purse that has higher capacity than the capacity of the best purse this hero is currently holding. Return false otherwise.
            result == (item.isArmor() && bestArmor == null || armor.getFullProtection() > bestArmor.getFullProtection())
             || (item.isWeapon() && bestWeapon == null || weapon.getDamage() > bestWeapon.getDamage())
             || (item.isBackpack() && bestBackpack == null || backpack.getCapacity() > bestBackpack.getCapacity())
             || (item.isPurse() && purse.getCapacity() > thisPurse.getCapacity())

      • collectTreasure

        public void collectTreasure(Item item)
        Pick up the item when this character wants to take it.
        Specified by:
        collectTreasure in class Character
        Parameters:
        item - the treasure to collect
        Effects:
      • When this item is a backpack, all treasures inside this backpack will be collected.
            if (item.isBackpack()) then
             collectTreasures((Backpack) item)
      • When this item is a purse, it will be equipped when better than the current purse.
            if (item.isPurse()) then
             equip(AnchorType.BELT, (Purse)item)
      • When this item is a purse, the contents of the old purse will be added to the new purse when the new purse won't tear, otherwise no contents are added.
            newPurse.add(oldPurse)
      • Otherwise this hero will pick up the item when he wants to take it
            if (!item.isBackpack() && !item.isPurse() && wantsToTake(item)) then
             pickUp(item)

      • hit

        public void hit(Character character)
         throws DeadException
        Make the character hit the given character.
        Specified by:
        hit in class Character
        Parameters:
        character - the character to hit
        Postcondition:
        When the given character dies, this hero's fighting state will be set to false
            new.isFighting() == false
        Effects:
      • A random number between 0 and 100 is generated, when this number is higher than the character's protection and the character is not dead, the character takes the damage of this hero. When this number is lower than the character's protection, nothing happens.
            character.takeDamage(getDamage())
      • When the given character dies, this hero will be healed
            heal()
      • When the given character dies, it's treasures will be collected
            collectTreasures(character)
        • Throws:
        DeadException - Throws this exception when the current hero is dead. | isDead()

      • heal

        public void heal()
          throws DeadException
        Heal the hero by adding hitpoints.
        Postcondition:
        The hero's new hitpoints is a random prime number between its current health and its max health.
            MathHelper.isPrime(new.getHitpoints())
        Throws:
        DeadException - Throws this exception when the current hero is dead. | isDead()

      • getDamage

        public int getDamage()
        Return the damage of the hero.
        Specified by:
        getDamage in class Character
        Returns:
        Return the damage of the hero as the sum of his weapons in his hands and strength minus ten and divided by two. When this result is negative, zero is returned.
            result == (int)((float)(AnchorType.RIGHT_HAND.getAnchorId() + AnchorType.LEFT_HAND.getAnchorId() + this.getStrength() -10)/2)

      • canPickUp

        public boolean canPickUp(Item item)
        Check whether an item can be picked up.
        Overrides:
        canPickUp in class Character
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be picked up
        Returns:
        Return false when the item can not be picked up by a character. Return false when the item is an armor and the new armor count will exceed the maximum armor count. Return false when the item is a backpack and the new armor count will exceed the maximum armor count. Return true otherwise.
            result == super.canPickUp(item) && !(item.isArmor() && this.getArmorCount() >= getMaxArmorCount())
             && !(item.isBackpack() && ((Backpack)item).getArmorCount() + this.getArmorCount() > getMaxArmorCount())

      • canHaveAsItemAt

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsItemAt(int anchorId,
                                    Item item)
        Check whether the given item can be equipped.
        Overrides:
        canHaveAsItemAt in class Character
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be checked
        Returns:
        Return true when the given item can be equipped.
            result == super.canHaveAsItemAt(anchorId, item) &&
             ((AnchorType.getTypeFromId(anchorId).holdsPurse() == true) && item.isPurse()) ||
             !item.isPurse()

      • getArmorCount

        @Raw
public int getArmorCount()
        Return the amount of armor's equipped by this character.
        Returns:
        Return the amount of armor's equipped by this character also looks inside anchored backpacks.
            result == sum ({item in getAnchoredItems() :
             if (item.isArmor()) then 1
             else ((Backpack)item).getArmorCount()
             })
